info.description: The Compensation service enables applications to extend Workday's HCM Compensation features.
info.title: compensation

tags.name: scorecardResults
tags.description: Provides the ability to set up and retrieve Scores on Scorecard Results.

tags.name: scorecards
tags.description: Provides the ability to set up and retrieve Scores on Scorecard Results.

get.summary: Provides the ability to set up and retrieve Scores on Scorecard Results.
get.description: Retrieves the Scorecard Results. Secured by: Set Up: Merit and Bonus Scope: Advanced Compensation

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.description: In the request body, specify these required fields: * compensationScorecard - The Workday ID of a Compensation Scorecard. You can use a returned id from the GET /scorecards method. * evaluationDate - The date when the Scorecard Result is evaluated. Use the yyyy-mm-dd format. Secured by: Set Up: Merit and Bonus Scope: Advanced Compensation

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

Change the Evaluation Date to a date that is on or after the Effective Date of the selected Scorecard. The specified Evaluation Date is before the earliest Effective Date of the selected Scorecard.

Either specify a different Evaluation Date or edit the existing Scores. The Scorecard Result for the specified Scorecard and Evaluation Date already exists:([scores])

get.summary: Provides the ability to set up and retrieve Scores on Scorecard Results.
get.description: Retrieves the Scorecard Results. Secured by: Set Up: Merit and Bonus Scope: Advanced Compensation

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

delete.summary: Deletes the Scorecard Results with the specified ID.
delete.description: Deletes the Scorecard Results with the specified ID. Secured by: Set Up: Merit and Bonus Scope: Advanced Compensation

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Deleting resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

You can’t delete the Scorecard Results used in a completed or in-progress compensation review process.

get.description: Retrieves Compensation Scorecard information including the scorecardName, scorecardDescription, inactive status, defaultScorecardGoals, scorecardProfiles containing profileScorecardGoals as of the effective date. The default effective date is the request date. Secured by: Set Up: Merit and Bonus Scope: Advanced Compensation

parameters.name: effectiveDate
parameters.description: Effective date the scorecard task takes effect.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.description: Creates a new Compensation Scorecard. In the request body, specify these required fields: scorecardName, effectiveDate, and defaultScorecardGoals[ {goalName, goalWeight} ]. If you specify the optional scorecardProfiles[], you must specify the eligibilityRule{id} and at least 1 goal in profileScorecardGoals[ {goalName, goalWeight} ]. Secured by: Set Up: Merit and Bonus Scope: Advanced Compensation

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

A Default Scorecard \~Goal\~ is missing

A \~Goal\~ is missing for a Scorecard Profile.

Scorecard Name entered has already been used.

The sum of the \~goal\~ weightings must equal 100%.

There are duplicate eligibility rules on this request.

\~Goal\~ Weights must be greater than 0.

get.description: Retrieves a worker instance with the specific ID. Secured by: FLW Service, Self-Service: Current Staffing Information, Worker Data: Public Worker Reports Scope: Staffing

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves all workers. Use the search parameter to search for workers by name. The search is case-insensitive. Secured by: FLW Service, Self-Service: Current Staffing Information, Worker Data: Public Worker Reports Scope: Staffing

parameters.name: includeTerminatedWorkers
parameters.description: Include terminated workers in the output

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Request a one-time payment for a worker with the specified ID.
post.description: Creates a one-time payment for a worker with the specified ID, and initiates the Request One-Time Payment business process. In the request body, specify at least these required fields: reason{id}, position{id}, oneTimePayments[ paymentCurrency{id}, oneTimePaymentPlan {id}]. Sample format for paymentAmount: "payment Amount": { "value": "2500" } Secured by: Request One-Time Payment (REST Service) Scope: Core Compensation

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

A One-Time Payment plan is required.

At least 1 One-Time Payment is required.

Based on the worktag type configuration following worktag types are not valid for taggable type [tt]: [awt]. Please remove all worktags for the invalid worktag types.

Compensation Change cannot take place before \~Employee\~ Hire Date.

Coverage Start Date and Coverage End Date can not be entered for a One-Time Payment Plan that does not have Coverage Dates enabled.

Effective Date is required.

Either an amount or a percent for the One-Time Payment is required.

If specifying a Coverage Date range, then both dates must be specified.

Multiple One-Time Payment is not enabled. Please enable Multiple One-Time Payment in HCM Tenant Setup - Compensation.

Only one worktag for each type is allowed for each document line.

Please use a valid One-Time Payment plan.

Position submitted is not filled as of the effective date.

Scheduled Payment Date cannot take place before the One Time Payment Effective Date.

Scheduled Payment Date must be equal to Event Effective Date when Multiple One-Time Payment is not enabled in Edit Tenant Setup - HCM.

Select a balancing worktag for Worktags of the following type: [type]

The coverage period End Date must be on or after Start Date.

The following Accounting Worktags are required but have not been assigned: [missing].

The job is not valid for the \~employee\~.

The \~Employee\~ Visibility Date has been set to a value, but the \~Employee\~ Visibility Feature has not been activated in the HCM Tenant settings. Please leave the date blank or activate the feature in the tenant level settings.

The \~Employee\~ Visibility Date must be on or after the Effective Date.

The \~employee\~ you have selected has more than one job. You must supply the job to which this operation applies.

patch.summary: Updates the Score for the specified Scorecard Result.
patch.description: Sets the achievement value for the specified Score in the specified Scorecard Result. Specify the required achievement value as a percentage (1-100%). Secured by: Set Up: Merit and Bonus Scope: Advanced Compensation

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Updating resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

You can’t update Scorecard Results used in a completed compensation review process.

get.description: Retrieves Compensation Scorecard information including the scorecardName, scorecardDescription, inactive status, defaultScorecardGoals, scorecardProfiles containing profileScorecardGoals as of the effective date. The default effective date is the request date. Secured by: Set Up: Merit and Bonus Scope: Advanced Compensation

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

put.description: Replaces an existing Compensation Scorecard as of the specified effectiveDate. Call GET /scorecards/{ID} to initially populate the request body with the existing data. You can then update the scorecardName, scorecardDescription, and inactive fields. You can also add, update, and delete the existing data in defaultScorecardGoals[], scorecardProfiles[], and profileScorecardGoals[]. Secured by: Set Up: Merit and Bonus Scope: Advanced Compensation

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Updating resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

A Default Scorecard \~Goal\~ is missing

A Scorecard Profile doesn't exist as of the Effective Date. Remove or replace the invalid Scorecard Profile or change the Effective Date.

A Scorecard Profile is already in use on another Scorecard. Select a Scorecard Profile that's not already in use.

A \~Goal\~ doesn't exist as of the Effective Date. Remove or replace the invalid \~Goal\~ or change the Effective Date.

A \~Goal\~ is invalid. Enter a valid \~Goal\~.

A \~Goal\~ is missing for a Scorecard Profile.

Enter an Effective Date that is on or after the first Effective Date of the scorecard: [effectiveDate].

Scorecard Name entered has already been used.

The sum of the \~goal\~ weightings must equal 100%.

There are duplicate eligibility rules on this request.

You can't edit the compensation scorecard [scorecard] for the Effective Date [date] because the latest dated performance results associated with the scorecard is the date [latest date]. Enter an Effective Date for editing the scorecard that is after the following date: [latest date]

You entered duplicate Scorecard Profiles. Replace or remove the duplicates.

You entered duplicate \~Goals\~. Replace or remove the duplicates.

\~Goal\~ Weights must be greater than 0.

delete.summary: Deletes a Compensation Scorecard with the specified ID.
delete.description: Deletes Compensation Scorecards. Secured by: Set Up: Merit and Bonus Scope: Advanced Compensation

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Deleting resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

The Compensation Scorecard cannot be deleted because it is in use.

coverageEndDate.description: The end date of the Coverage Period for the payment, which enables Workday Payroll or Payroll Integration to associate dates with the one-time payment for Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) reporting requirements.

paymentPercent.description: The actual amount for the \~bonus\~ payment represented as a percentage.  The percentage is usually calculated as a percentage of base pay, but on the \~bonus\~ plan setup it is possible to override the calculation basis to calculate as a percentage of a set of compensation elements.

sendToPayroll.description: This is true if you selected Send to Payroll on the \~bonus\~ payment, future payment, or one-time payment. If false, Workday Payroll doesn't process the payment.

scheduledPaymentDate.description: The payment date scheduled for the one-time payment request.

payrollWorktags.description: One-Time Payment Worktags for REST API

coverageStartDate.description: The start date of the Coverage Period for the payment, which enables Workday Payroll or Payroll Integration to associate dates with the one-time payment for Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) reporting requirements.
